info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 1:13AM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Missoula, northeastern Granite and west central Powell Counties through 200 AM MDT... At 113 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles northwest of Philipsburg, or 25 miles southwest of Drummond, moving north at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half-inch size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Drummond, Nimrod, Hall, New Chicago and Bearmouth. This includes Interstate 90 between mile markers 129 and 155. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
